title: In pictures: A forgotten art form kept alive at Rajmoni Circus
body: The circus, once a dominant form of entertainment across Bangladesh, holds a rich tradition deeply connected with the cultural fabric of rural life. While the global influence of modern media has led to a decline in traditional circus performances, rural Bangladesh still retains a few places where this art form continues to flourish. One such troupe is the Rajmoni Circus, based in Thakurgaon, Bangladesh. For many years, Rajmoni Circus has traveled throughout Bangladesh, continuing to captivate audiences with its thrilling performances. At Rajmoni Circus, spectators can experience a variety of exciting performances. One of the most popular acts includes the daredevil performers who leap from great heights, executing acrobatic feats that seem impossible. There's also the mesmerizing sight of snake charmers, who bring live snakes into the arena, showcasing their delicate and seemingly dangerous skills. And of course, no circus is complete without the comedic relief of clowns, who don exaggerated costumes and perform humorous skits, spreading joy to the crowd. In the midst of a changing world, the Rajmoni Circus represents a vibrant link to the past, a reminder of a time when the circus was a source of wonder and joy for people across the country.
